laboratory_examinations.findings: 1 RBC, 7 nucleated cells (95% lymphocytes), normal protein and glucose, consistent with lymphocytic pleocytosis.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: A repeat LP revealed 14 nucleated cells (99% lymphocytic predominance), demonstrating persistent lymphocytic pleocytosis.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Negative for treponema pallidum, HIV, Epstein-Barr virus, enteroviruses, JC virus, and herpesviruses.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Positive West Nile Virus IgG in the CSF and serum with negative IgM in the CSF and serum.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Extensive non-enhancing white matter signal abnormalities, consistent with leukoencephalopathy.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI brain scans at three and nine months showed an interval decrease in abnormal signal change.
